meanings.definition: A substance used to seal gaps or joints to prevent leakage or infiltration.
meanings.sent1: The workers applied sealants to the windows to keep the rain out.
meanings.sent2: Dentists often recommend sealants to protect teeth from cavities.
meanings.sent3: The sealants on the door were so strong that not even a mouse could sneak through.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was like sealants, keeping her heart safe from harm.
meanings.sent5: The sealants acted like a shield, blocking any water from seeping in.

meanings.definition: A material applied to the surface of teeth to prevent decay.
meanings.sent1: The dentist suggested sealants to protect my teeth from cavities.
meanings.sent2: Children can benefit from sealants to keep their teeth healthy.
meanings.sent3: The sealants on his teeth made him feel like a superhero with shiny armor.
meanings.sent4: Her smile sparkled like diamonds, thanks to the sealants on her teeth.
meanings.sent5: The sealants were like tiny guardians, defending the teeth from decay.

meanings.definition: A coating applied to concrete to protect it from moisture and chemicals.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used sealants to shield the concrete from water damage.
meanings.sent2: Sealants can extend the lifespan of concrete structures.
meanings.sent3: The sealants on the sidewalk were like a magical barrier against spills.
meanings.sent4: The sealants wrapped the concrete like a protective cloak, keeping it safe.
meanings.sent5: The sealants formed a strong fortress around the concrete, repelling any threats.
